pageContext.claim: “I think you read about it -- where 62 percent of the people say they're not even telling the truth on polling and where the polling is fake.”
pageContext.analysis: False. A survey from the Cato Institute found that 62 percent of Americans say they have views they are afraid to share in public. Nowhere does that Cato survey say that 62 percent of Americans give false responses to pollsters. Pollsters do not know the people they call to survey and in many cases the responses are simply converted into data without identifying information.
